item.title: glimpses Insights
item.description: This post is about a simple interactive visualizaton I made of glimpses analytics data, which reflects the global distribution of glimpses users with maximum sessions. Thanks to Tableau Public and github-pages, I found these two solutions immensly helpful in creating, embedding and publishing viz. Tableau Public is a free software that can connect to a file (Excel, CSV, JSON..) or to a server and create stunning interactive data visualizations for the web.

item.title: Daily log: 3 simple steps to keep your daily log üìù
item.description: For me, it is important to keep track of daily tasks I do at work. And there are loads of tools üîß available to help you do that. However most of the time, on your work machine / office laptop üíª, you do not have the privilege to install the tool of your choice. So here, I just wanted to share a little-known simple & neat trick üî®, that I have been using more than a decade successfully which is built right into the Window‚Äôs default Notepad app.

item.title: GitHub Auto Tagger
item.description: I keep track of all my work using GitHub project boards. To simplify, automate & improve GitHub issue management workflow therefore to scratch my own itch, I made simple GitHub Probot app autotagger. It automatically tags GitHub Issues based on the matched pattern. Simply mention your tags in square brackets […] on Issue title. Please install autotagger, I’d love to hear your feedback. You can find more details about the Probot from here.

item.title: RabbitMQ üê∞
item.description: _______________ < Im not rabbit!! > --------------- \ ^__^ \ (oo)\_______ (__)\ )\/\ ||----w | || || Today at work, had to demonstrate a proof of concept (POC) related to message queues, so need to spin-up a rabbitmq server. “Play with Docker” come to the rescue. In couple of minutes environment is up and ready. docker run -d \ --hostname rabbit-host \ --name rabbit-container \ -p 80:15672 \ -p 5672:5672 \ -e RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_USER="rabbit" \ -e RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_PASS="carrot" \ rabbitmq:3-management PORT Description 15672 RabbitMQ Management console uses PORT 15672 for RabbitMQ version 3.

item.title: Play with docker
item.description:
Prerequisite Make sure you have already created a Docker Hub account. PWD This post is about “Play with Docker” chrome-extension. Play with Docker(PWD) by itself is a simple, interactive and fun playground to learn Docker. This will give you a throwaway *nix shell, in which you can safely play with docker.
Extension adds a “Try in PWD” button on any Docker Hub image page. Here is a short demo of same.

item.title: CURL
item.description: As part of my journey as a developer and decision to document my learning, I’ve been thinking of writing a short post regarding curl, here it is. Curl is a command line tool for transferring data to and from a server. Curl stands for Client URL and was developed by a Swedish developer Daniel Stenberg @bagder. It covers many protocols like HTTP, FTP, IMAP, POP3 & SMTP, It usually comes pre-installed in most of Linux distros and modern versions of OS X.

item.title: Rapid Prototyping
item.description: This is to document my last remote consulting experience for a Mobile Application. In order to get clarity in design, we often go through a prototype phase. This is an important phase as this allows you to refine the user experience. Although there are a huge number of tools out there that are dedicated solely to prototyping. I’ve seen effective prototypes made with PowerPoint, Keynote, Acrobat, and Word. If you’re a designer and have skills in programs like high-end graphic software like Sketch.

item.title: XAML Styler for Visual Studio Mac
item.description: If you have already worked on WPF or Windows Phone projects, you might have used the XAML Styler. Which is a visual studio extension for formatting XAML source code, which helps in maintaining better XAML coding style and better XAML readability. I have been using this extension for quite some time including my Xamarin Forms projects in Xamarin Studio. Even though ‚ÄúVisual Studio for Mac‚Äù was available, I remained with Xamarin Studio as XAML Styler was not supported in VS for MAC.

item.title: Working with Microsoft
item.description: A couple of months back I got a chance to work with Microsoft Middle East, Dubai¬† to port the glimpses¬†win32 app into Microsoft Store. It was really important for us to be able to take advantage of the best that windows 10 has to offer without rebuilding the glimpses app. Desktop Bridge provided the perfect solution for us to be able to keep all the work we‚Äôve done before and embrace future, it is an obvious choice for us to give a more trustworthy source to users.

item.title: [dev] Record your screen on Android!!
item.description: Ever wanted to record a tutorial or wanted to create a demo of your app you’d need to capture the screen in real time. Without installing any of third-party software this is daunting. So below is one of the easy steps to follow for geeks in you. Download the platform-tools from below URL if you don’t have Android Studio installed. developer.android.com Connect your Android Phone to your computer. Make sure you have selected the option “Use USB for” to “File transfers” Open the command prompt (Win+R) Enter the below command adb shell and press “Enter” key Write the below command to record the screen screenrecord /sdcard/download/fileName.
